description.narrative: Outcome 1: Local human rights actors are actively undertaking and facilitating initiatives on human rights and gender issues. Outcome 2: Disempowered people have increased access to justice through legal aid Outcome 3: Working Children increasigly enjoy fundamental human rights Outcome 4: State institutions are increasingly responsive to respecting human rights under their jurisdiction
Core support to the next phase of ASK's programme addressing the human rights situation in Bangladesh during 2017-2021.
Sidas stöd består av kärnstöd till nästkommande fas, 2017-2021, av Ain o Salish Kendra's initiativ med fokus på situationen i Bangladesh avseende mänskliga rättigheter.

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
During 2020, ASK has reported achievement of most of the targets as outlined under the current project phase. ASK, together with its partner NGOs and CBOs, continued to action against human rights violations, including gender-based violence. Through campaigns to raise human rights awareness, training, capacity building, and advocacy, ASK has been able to mobilize the human rights actors and stakeholders to promote and defend human rights of the disadvantaged and disempowered groups, marginalized individuals and communities, especially girls, women as well as the diverse minority groups.
During the reporting period, 290 violence against women (VAW) and children were addressed by ASK. The survivors received support from ASK's local partners who responded to matters that included domestic violence as a result of family matters, physical torture, dowry, sexual harassment of young girls, trafficking, confinement by family member(s) and society, etc. Community based women's groups have been formed with representation of local women in different committees such as Union Council (rural administrative level) Committees, School Management Committees, Community Protection Committee, Union Legal Aid committee, etc. The women regularly monitor the local level human rights violations related to Violence Against Women and Girls, Early Marriage, Domestic Violence, fair distribution of COVID-19 related response/package. etc. During the pandemic period, they assisted the poorest and those deserving to get the government relief and monitored the distribution of the assistance at the community level. Apart from these they also assisted the victims of human rights violations to get legal aid and other relevant services. On improving access to justice, ASK reported that 15,928 disempowered women received legal assistance from ASK which helped them to access the justice system. Of this number, 95% of the complaints were related to family matters which were dealt through Alternative Dispute Resolution.
ASK's advocacy work to make state institutions more responsive towards upholding human rights under their jurisdictions has led to various Ministries and government authorities, including the law enforcement agencies to take actions on ASK's appeal for intervention on human rights issues. Incidents of human rights violations were observed to increased rapidly during the pandemic and many complaints regarding the health sector and its administration were published in the newspapers as well as corruption in relief management, gender based violence, and child marriage. ASK appealed in 179 cases on various HRVs for the reporting period. In many cases Government did not respond immediately.
ASK continues to advocate for sustaining the virtual court system at all levels of conflict resolutions, so that it helps to ensure citizens access to justice. During the reporting period, ASK has developed a report assessing the performance of National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) in the last 10 years and another report with the Mid-term assessment on the implementation progress of Universal Periodic Review (UPR). The findings of both assessments will help ASK to design and implement its planned advocacy initiatives in 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
